isis.stitle: Lucas Varity/TRW Hydraulic Antilock Brake System - DISASSEMBLE - ELECTRO-HYDRAULIC CONTROL UNIT

important.para: Do not pry on the ECU or HCU with a mechanical aid. Excessive force will cause damage to the units.

step1.para: Remove the EHCU (refer to removal of the EHCU).

important.para: Important: Avoid touching the pins of the electrical connectors on the ECU. Damage could occur, due to electrostatic discharge.

step1.para: Disconnect the 2-way connector from the electrical interconnect between the ECU and HCU (it is located on the side of the EHCU that was next to the frame rail).

important.para: Always insure hydraulic connections and components are kept clean to prevent contamination.

step1.para: Remove the four T-25 Torx® bolts which fasten the ECU to the HCU.
Remove the ECU from the HCU. A light amount of force may be required.
